SENT.plain: A man aged 75 years and with nonischemic cardiomyopathy had implantation of a biventricular implantable cardiac defibrillator (ICD)
Consistent biventricular pacing was limited by intermittent T-wave oversensing (TWOS)
A strategy of left-ventricular-only pacing was used to eliminate TWOS
This strategy obviates the need to reduce ventricular sensitivity and thus may be an effective alternative to biventricular pacing complicated by TWOS
